subject: Add tizen native API
commitMessage:
Add tizen native API

To support Tizen 2.3 native application, add tizen native api to message port library.

Change-Id: I90928fc241639273a629cc171f847b03af641afb
Signed-off-by: Hurnjoo Lee <hurnjoo.lee@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I don't prefer this change to support Tizen 2.3 Native API. The major gaps between 2.3 API and 2.1(current implementation) are:
 * API naming ( messageport -> message_port) - it can be solved by separate header.
 * support for 'userdata' argument in API - this can be done in library code itself, than wrapping.

The other major issue is source code licensing conflict: LGPL 2.1 Vs Apache.

Patch Set 5:

Thanks for your review.

 > I don't prefer this change to support Tizen 2.3 Native API. The
 > major gaps between 2.3 API and 2.1(current implementation) are:
 > * API naming ( messageport -> message_port) - it can be solved by
 > separate header.
Could you please explain this in more detail?
headers are already separated.(2.3 Native API : message_port.h, current implementation : message-port.h)

 > * support for 'userdata' argument in API - this can be done in
 > library code itself, than wrapping.
 > 
 > The other major issue is source code licensing conflict: LGPL 2.1
 > Vs Apache.

Patch Set 5:

> Thanks for your review.
 > 
 > > I don't prefer this change to support Tizen 2.3 Native API. The
 > > major gaps between 2.3 API and 2.1(current implementation) are:
 > > * API naming ( messageport -> message_port) - it can be solved by
 > > separate header.
 > Could you please explain this in more detail?
 > headers are already separated.(2.3 Native API : message_port.h,
 > current implementation : message-port.h)
 > 
 > > * support for 'userdata' argument in API - this can be done in
 > > library code itself, than wrapping.
 > >
 > > The other major issue is source code licensing conflict: LGPL 2.1
 > > Vs Apache.

 > Thanks for your review.
 > 
 > > I don't prefer this change to support Tizen 2.3 Native API. The
 > > major gaps between 2.3 API and 2.1(current implementation) are:
 > > * API naming ( messageport -> message_port) - it can be solved by
 > > separate header.
 > Could you please explain this in more detail?
 > headers are already separated.(2.3 Native API : message_port.h,
 > current implementation : message-port.h)
I mean here is, instead of redefining everything(error codes, functions etc) the new header can just reuse existing apis by defining preprocessor macros(#define new_api existing_api).

Patch Set 5:

I mean here is, instead of redefining everything(error codes, functions etc) the new header can just reuse existing apis by defining preprocessor macros(#define new_api existing_api).

Patch Set 7:

Hurnjoo Lee, Thank you for your efforts. I have few concerns.

- The 'userdata' changes should be handled in MsgPortService object itself. So the new additional parameter should add to below functions:
  _messageport_register_port()
  msgport_manager_register_service()
  msgport_service_set_message_handler()
  _create_and_cache_service()
  msgport_service_new()
[If you are fine, i can push this change.]

- For logging please follow the existing logging macros(refer to common/log.h).

- How important is to use tizen common error codes, i have no idea about this. My concern is this is adding new dependency.
